meanings.definition: The quality or state of being jagged.
meanings.sent1: The jaggedness of the rocks made climbing difficult.
meanings.sent2: The jaggedness of the torn paper made it hard to handle.
meanings.sent3: The jaggedness of the puzzle pieces added an extra challenge to the game.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a jaggedness to it, like broken glass tinkling.
meanings.sent5: The jaggedness of the lightning split the sky in a dazzling display.

meanings.definition: The rough or uneven edges or projections of something.
meanings.sent1: He carefully avoided the jaggedness of the broken glass on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The jaggedness of the metal edges could cause injury if not handled properly.
meanings.sent3: The jaggedness of the cookie made it look like a piece of modern art.
meanings.sent4: The jaggedness of the mountain peaks contrasted with the smoothness of the valley below.
meanings.sent5: The jaggedness of the old fence gave it a weathered and rustic charm.
